column1: Which service enables you to set up directories in the AWS cloud, or connect your AWS resources with an existing on-premises Microsoft Active Directory?
Which of the following AWS service enables customers to analyze, investigate, and identify the root cause of potential security issues or suspicious activities in their AWS environment?
Which of the following security group rules are valid? (Select TWO.)
Outbound HTTPS rule with hostname as destination
Inbound TCP rule with instance ID as source
Outbound MYSQL rule with IP address as source
Inbound RDP rule with an address range as source
Inbound HTTP rule with security group ID as source
column2: Inbound HTTP rule with security group ID as source

column1: Inbound RDP rule with an address range as source
A company plans to migrate their on-premises MySQL database to Amazon RDS. Which AWS service should they use for this task?
A customer in North Virginia, USA, is doing some drone work and collecting environmental data.
Which of the following options allows easy access to terabytes of data storage for use in a space-constrained environment and allows data transfer to AWS?
Which AWS service allows for easy management of access to multiple AWS accounts and provides users with single login access?

A leading company wants to ensure that its cloud services are consistently delivered at the agreed-upon level of its business stakeholders. The company is considering using the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) to guide its cloud operations.
Which capabilities within the AWS CAF's Operations perspective would be most helpful for the company?
Which of the following is a data transport solution that accelerates moving terabytes to petabytes of data into and out of AWS using appliances with on-board storage and compute capabilities?
Which of the following AWS services are used to secure a VPC network? (Select TWO.)
A company needs access to the full set of monitoring checks in AWS Trusted Advisor to ensure that its cloud environment is well-architected.
What is the MOST cost-effective support plan that the company should avail of?
An e-commerce company wants to migrate its on-premises infrastructure to Amazon Web Services. However, they are worried about ensuring their migration is secure and efficient.
Which of the following AWS Cloud Adoption Framework perspective would be the most essential for the company's migration?
A manufacturing company plans to host a business-critical application on a single Amazon EC2 instance.
What is the best way to increase the application's resilience with the LEAST operational overhead?
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple VPCs.
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application using CloudFormation StackSets in different AWS accounts.
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple subnets.
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones
column2: Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.

column1: Which of the following services will be able to reroute traffic to your secondary EC2 instances in another region during disaster recovery?
Which of the following can you use to resolve the connection between your on-premises VPN and your Amazon VPC (Amazon Virtual Private Cloud)? (Select TWO.)
Where can you track the costs you've incurred so far in your AWS account with a graphical visualization?
Which of the following AWS services can be used to turn text into a lifelike speech, allowing you to create applications that talk and run speech-enabled products?
Which of the following is not a standard design principle when designing systems in AWS?
Disposable resources instead of fixed servers
What service will allow you to sell your catalog of custom AMIs in AWS?
Which of the following is an AWS service that provides secure key storage and cryptographic operations, such as encryption and decryption, hashing, and digital signing?
In compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) federal law, a US-based company is required to provide SOC 1 and SOC 2 reports of its cloud resources.
Where are these AWS compliance documents located?

A company decided to migrate its operation to the AWS Cloud by leveraging on the different AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) perspectives to identify capability gaps and cross-organizational dependencies.
Which phase of the cloud transformation journey do these plans belong to?
Auto-Scaling based on demand is an implementation of which AWS cloud best practice?
Which of the following does the Enterprise support plan provide to customers in AWS? (Select TWO.)
15-minute response time support if your production system goes down
Limited access to the 7 Core Trusted Advisor checks
5-minute response time support if your business-critical system goes down
Which AWS service helps identify resources shared with an external entity and generates policies based on access activity?
Which AWS service lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources?
Which AWS service allows your EC2 compute capacity to automatically scale based on the incoming traffic?
Which of the following Cost Management Tools allows tracking of Amazon EC2 Reserved Instance (RI) usage and provides visibility into the discounted RI rate charged to resources?
Which of the following should be set up in order to connect the Amazon VPC network to the local network via an IPsec tunnel?
VPC Peering connection between your on-premises network and VPC
An on-premises NAT gateway device connected to your VPC's Internet Gateway
A NAT gateway in your private subnet connected to your on-premises network
A VPN gateway in your VPC connected to the Customer Gateway in your on-premises network
column2: A VPN gateway in your VPC connected to the Customer Gateway in your on-premises network

column1: Among the following services, which is the most suitable one to use to store the results of I/O-intensive SQL database queries to improve application performance?
Which of the following security features can be enabled in Amazon Workspaces to ensure compliance with regulations and protect sensitive data?
Allowing employees to use their personal devices for work.
Storing sensitive data in an unencrypted form in the workspace.
Enabling multi-factor authentication for user access to workspaces.
Disabling firewalls and antivirus software in the workspace for better performance.
column2: Enabling multi-factor authentication for user access to workspaces.

column1: Which of the following AWS resources is a zonal service? (Select TWO.)
What is the MOST affordable AWS Support plan that provides users access to the AWS Support API?
Which of the following is needed to retrieve a list of Amazon EC2 instances using the AWS CLI?
Which of the following is a key use case of AWS Control Tower?
An easy way to establish a landing zone that implements an AWS well-architected, multi-account environment and applies the AWS best practices.
A way for customers to send instructions to an AWS account on how to deploy popular technologies such as WordPress.
A centralized logging service for all types of log files.
A fast monitoring engine used to detect if any of your AWS accounts deviate from the AWS best practices.
column2: An easy way to establish a landing zone that implements an AWS well-architected, multi-account environment and applies the AWS best practices.

column1: A company wants to ensure its employees can easily find and deploy approved IT services on AWS to preserve compliance with organizational policies.
Which AWS service can help them achieve this goal?

Availability Zones are physically separated by a meaningful distance from any other AZ, although all are within 100 km or 60 miles of each other. What is the primary reason why Availability Zones are set up the way they are now?
To achieve better network connectivity to users in the location
Price of the land is cheaper in those locations
To maximize area coverage in a Region
To keep them as far apart from each other in case of a disaster
column2: To keep them as far apart from each other in case of a disaster

column1: An organization plans to build an online application form with a detection capability to recognize attributes appearing in the images. This feature will remove forms that contain inappropriate photos uploaded by users. However, the development team has no experience building machine-learning models.
Which of the following services would you recommend?
Tutorials Dojo would like to test their new mobile app on multiple devices at once in a coordinated fashion using AWS. Which of the following services will help speed up the process?
Which AWS service enables the grouping of users with similar functions and the application of function-specific privileges?
In the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, whose responsibility is it to patch the host operating system of an Amazon EC2 instance?
An employee is asking for access to your S3 buckets. What should be the level of access that you should provide to him?
Ask what type of access he requires and only provide him those permissions

column2: Ask what type of access he requires and only provide him those permissions

column1: A company plans to encrypt and manage its own encryption keys using a single-tenant hardware security module. The company must also have exclusive control over how its keys are used via an authentication mechanism independent from AWS.
Which service would meet that requirement?
Which of the following is one of the benefits of migrating your systems from an on-premises data center to AWS Cloud?
Eliminates the need for the customer to implement client-side or service-side encryption for their data
Enables the customer to eliminate high IT infrastructure costs since cloud computing is absolutely free
Enables the customer to focus on business activities rather than on the heavy lifting of racking, stacking, and powering servers
Completely eliminates the administrative overhead of patching the guest operating system of their EC2 instances
column2: Enables the customer to focus on business activities rather than on the heavy lifting of racking, stacking, and powering servers

column1: A company plans to migrate its on-premises applications and workloads to AWS. It needs to digitally transform and accelerate its business outcomes by leveraging on AWS experience and best practices to improve business outcomes.
Which of the following can be used to accelerate the company's cloud-driven business transformation?

A Cloud Architect in a large e-commerce company manages the company's AWS environment. One day, the Cloud Architect was notified that one of their EC2 instances had been running non-stop for over 30 days, and its usage costs had skyrocketed. The Cloud Architect needs to identify the root cause of the issue and find a way to reduce the usage costs of the instance.
Which of the following AWS services can help the Cloud Architect identify the issue and check if their running resources conform to AWS best practices?
Which service offers volume discounts when you enable Consolidated Billing?
Which of the following services would allow a company to mask the application's downtime by rerouting the traffic to healthy instances? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following services allow the purchase of Reserved Instances? (Select TWO.)
A Systems Administrator needs to create an account that will be used for long-term programmatic access to AWS. Which of the following IAM entities should be used to comply with this requirement?
What is the best type of instance purchasing option to choose if you will run an EC2 instance for 3 months to perform a job that is uninterruptible?
Which of the following RDS engines allows you to bring your own license (BYOL)?
Which cloud computing advantage describes how you can easily deploy your application in multiple AWS regions with just a few clicks?
Benefit from massive economies of scale
Stop spending money running and maintaining data centers
A company is using Cost Explorer to gain an understanding of its cost trends in AWS. How many months of historical data can Cost Explorer store and display?
Which of the following Amazon EC2 instance purchasing options can help you address compliance requirements and reduce costs by allowing you to use your existing server-bound software licenses?
Which of the following is a valid characteristic of an IAM Group?
A group can contain many users, and a user can belong to multiple groups.
There's no limit to the number of groups you can have.
There is a default group that automatically includes all users in the AWS account.
column2: A group can contain many users, and a user can belong to multiple groups.

column1: There is an incident with your team where an S3 object was deleted using an account without the owner's knowledge. What can be done to prevent unauthorized deletion of your S3 objects?
Configure MFA delete on the S3 bucket.
Create access control policies so that only you can perform S3-related actions
Set your S3 buckets to private so that objects are not publicly readable/writable
Set up stricter IAM policies that will prevent users from deleting S3 objects
column2: Configure MFA delete on the S3 bucket.

column1: Which of the following provides you access to Reserved Instance (RI) purchase recommendations based on your past usage and indicate potential opportunities for savings as compared to On-Demand usage?
A company is planning to use AWS Cloud to augment the resources of their on-premises data center to better serve their customers around the world. How does a company benefit from using AWS?
Benefit from massive discounts from the Amazon.com shopping website
Replace low variable costs with upfront capital infrastructure expenses
Benefit from massive economies of scale
Replace high variable costs with upfront capital infrastructure expenses
column2: Benefit from massive economies of scale

column1: A website is experiencing varying levels of traffic throughout the day and is not fully consuming server capacity all the time. Which advantage does AWS Cloud provide over traditional data centers when it comes to handling traffic load?
Which Elastic Load Balancer can support path-based routing, host-based routing, and bi-directional communication channels using WebSockets?
Both the Application Load Balancer and Network Load Balancer

A gaming company needs a service that uses the AWS global network to optimize users' access speed to their applications through an anycast static IP address. Which of the following services fits this criteria?
__________ lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.
Which of the following characteristics correctly describes the Amazon Simple Storage Service? (Select TWO.)
A storage service with virtually unlimited space
A durable, high throughput file system
A highly durable object storage infrastructure
column2: A storage service with virtually unlimited space

column1: A highly durable object storage infrastructure
A company is using Amazon S3 to store their static media contents such as photos and videos. Which of the following should you use to provide specific users access to the bucket?

A company plans to migrate its existing on-premises infrastructure to the AWS Cloud. The current business workflows heavily rely on legacy systems. The company aims to evaluate AWS Cloud readiness first and prioritize business transformation opportunities before starting migration activities.
Which AWS service or tool can help achieve these requirements?

A company recently audited the usage of its Amazon EC2 instances, which are used by its various applications. The company discovered a lot of these instances are under-utilized and over-provisioned. They then decide to rightsize their set of Amazon EC2 instances to optimize the performance of their computing resources.
Which configuration change will meet this requirement with the LEAST operational overhead?
Change the instance purchasing option of the Amazon EC2 Instances from On-Demand to EC2 Instance Savings Plans.
Deploy an Auto Scaling Group behind an Elastic Load Balancer.
Utilize the AWS Compute Optimizer and apply the recommended reconfigurations.
Reserve compute capacity for Amazon EC2 instances through On-Demand Capacity Reservations.
column2: Utilize the AWS Compute Optimizer and apply the recommended reconfigurations.

column1: A company plans to streamline its native iOS application development process and harness the AWS cloud's capabilities for enhancing its build activities.
Which of the following should the company use to achieve these requirements?
Which AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar supports the design principle of performing operations as code?
Which of the following AWS services automates the creation, management, testing, and deployment of customized Amazon EC2 server images?
Which of the following are general design principles described in the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select TWO.)
Which AWS service uses machine learning to continuously monitor and detect unusual cloud expenditures in terms of cost and usage?
A company is migrating its on-premises workloads to a new architecture that is distributed between the AWS Cloud and its local data center.
Which of the following migration types best describes this move?

A company plans to migrate its multi-tier application to the AWS Cloud. The company wants to ensure that each tier (web, application, and database) can communicate with each other while also preventing unauthorized access through the use of security groups.
Which particular task can be performed by using security groups in AWS?
Apply a stateful firewall to an Amazon S3 bucket.
Enable exclusive access to Amazon EC2 instances inside an Amazon VPC via a specific port.
Prevent unauthorized access from malicious IP addresses at each tier's subnet.
Enhance the security of cached data managed by Amazon CloudFront.
column2: Enable exclusive access to Amazon EC2 instances inside an Amazon VPC via a specific port.

column1: Which AWS service allows machine learning models to be trained using SQL commands and enables the integration of trained models within a data warehouse for forecasting purposes?
intend to commit to utilizing AWS services in the long term for 1 or 3 years.
Which AWS pricing model or offering will meet these requirements in the MOST cost-effective way?
A manufacturing company plans to host a business-critical application on a single Amazon EC2 instance.
What is the best way to increase the application's resilience with the LEAST operational overhead?
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple subnets.
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple VPCs.
Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application using CloudFormation StackSets in different AWS accounts.
column2: Launch multiple EC2 instances of the application in multiple Availability Zones.

column1: Which of the following are the relevant stakeholders in the Platform perspective of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)? (Select TWO.)

A company plans to migrate its operations to AWS and wants to justify the value of the cloud migration. The company seeks to define its measurable business outcomes by identifying and prioritizing transformation opportunities using the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF).
Which phase of the cloud transformation journey do these plans belong to?
A startup plans to improve the security of its Amazon EC2 instances by applying security rules to subnets of the default VPC.
Which is the MOST suitable AWS service or tool that should be used to meet this requirement?

A logistics company operates a warehouse management system on-premises and wants to securely connect this system to its VPCs in the us-east-1. A connection needs to be established within one week to ensure continuous operations.
Which solution requires the least time to establish a secure connection?
Which statement below is correct regarding the components of the AWS Global Infrastructure?
An Availability Zone contains multiple AWS Regions.
An edge location contains multiple AWS Regions.
An Availability Zone contains edge locations.
An AWS Region contains multiple Availability Zones.
column2: An AWS Region contains multiple Availability Zones.

column1: What are the benefits of using Edge locations in AWS? (Select TWO.)
Improves application performance by delivering content closer to your users
Offers an easy-to-use edge computing device that is helpful for data migration
Provides caching which reduces the load on your origin servers
Provides highly scalable object storage for your static content
Seamlessly extends AWS to edge devices so they can act locally on the data they generate, while still using the cloud for management, analytics, and durable storage
column2: Improves application performance by delivering content closer to your users

column1: Provides caching which reduces the load on your origin servers

You need to launch a new EC2 Instance for a beta program which is scheduled to change its instance family, operating system and tenancy exactly 3 months after its trial period. Which type of Reserved Instance (RI) should you use?
Which AWS service is suitable for launching a highly scalable MySQL OLTP database?

A group of Software Engineers is working on a project that requires a new Microsoft SQL Server database to be hosted in AWS. The team needs to ensure that the database can be set up quickly and efficiently to meet an urgent deadline.
Which of the following AWS services should they use to meet their requirement? (Select TWO.)
A company has web servers running on Amazon EC2 instances that access a RESTful API hosted on their on-premises data center. What kind of architecture is the company using?
What are the things that you can implement to improve the security of your Identity and Access Management (IAM) users? (Select TWO.)
Block incoming traffic via Security Groups.
Block incoming traffic via Network ACL.
Configure a strong password policy for your users.
Configure a strong password policy for your users.
Which of the following are regarded as regional services in AWS? (Select TWO.)

A company is planning to launch a new system in AWS but they do not have an employee who has AWS-related expertise. Which of the following AWS channels can instead help the company design, architect, build, migrate, and manage their workloads and applications on AWS?

Which of the following options is an AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) perspective specifically tailored to ensure your cloud investments expedite your digital transformation goals and business outcomes?
Which of the following is true regarding the Developer support plan in AWS? (Select TWO.)
Full access to the AWS Support API
No access to the AWS Support API
Recommended if you have business and/or mission critical workloads in AWS
Limited access to the 7 Core Trusted Advisor checks
Has access to the full set of Trusted Advisor checks
column2: No access to the AWS Support API

column1: Limited access to the 7 Core Trusted Advisor checks
In the Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following options below is a shared control between AWS and the customer?
Physical and environmental controls of the AWS data centers
Which of the following is true regarding Elastic Load Balancing?
It is a virtual server that allows you to run your applications in the AWS Cloud.
It automatically increases or decreases the number of instances as the demand of your application changes.
It distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances, in multiple Availability Zones.
It translates domain names (such as www.tutorialsdojo.com) into numeric IP addresses (such as 192.0.2.1) that Amazon EC2 instances use to connect to each other.
column2: It distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances, in multiple Availability Zones.

column1: A company is planning to adopt a hybrid cloud architecture with AWS. Which of the following options can they use to help them estimate their costs?
A company is using multiple AWS services to host its application. It wants to ensure the environment is optimized by adhering to AWS best practices.
Which of the following services is capable of inspecting an AWS environment and making recommendations to owner expenditures, improve system performance and reliability, and close security gaps?

Which of the following channels shares a collection of offerings to help you achieve specific business outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption through paid engagements in several specialty practice areas?

A company has enlisted the help of TDojo Consulting Co. to assist them in designing an AWS disaster recovery solution for their on-premises bare metal servers and SQL databases. The solution should provide a rapid and efficient method of replicating their current environment in AWS with minimum data loss in the event of a disaster. The company would like to keep track of the status of the replication process.
Which tool should the team adopt for the DR solution?

A company has a hybrid cloud architecture where their on-premises data center interacts with their cloud resources in AWS. Which of the following services in AWS can you use to deploy a web application to the servers running on-premises? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following below are the benefits of using Consolidated billing in AWS? (Select TWO.)
Allows one member account to pay the charges of all the master accounts
Share the volume pricing and Reserved Instance discounts by combining the usage across all accounts in the organization
Consolidate together the billing and payment of both AWS accounts and Amazon Internet Services Pvt. Ltd (AISPL) accounts
You get one bill for multiple accounts
Consolidated all the bills from multiple AWS accounts for only $1 every month
column2: You get one bill for multiple accounts

column1: Share the volume pricing and Reserved Instance discounts by combining the usage across all accounts in the organization
Which of the following allows you to set coverage targets and receive alerts when your utilization drops below the threshold you define?
Which of the following AWS service provides managed compliance and security controls for workloads?
A company which has a basic support plan needs resources to deploy, test, and improve their AWS environment. Which of the following can they use for free?
AWS Support API for programmatic case management
AWS online documentation, whitepapers, blogs and support forums
In-person classes with an accredited AWS instructor
column2: AWS online documentation, whitepapers, blogs and support forums

column1: Which of the following is a key use case of AWS Control Tower?
A centralized logging service for all types of log files.
An easy way to establish a landing zone that implements an AWS well-architected, multi-account environment and applies the AWS best practices.
A way for customers to send instructions to an AWS account on how to deploy popular technologies such as WordPress.
A fast monitoring engine used to detect if any of your AWS accounts deviate from the AWS best practices.
column2: An easy way to establish a landing zone that implements an AWS well-architected, multi-account environment and applies the AWS best practices.

column1: Users from different parts of the globe are complaining about the slow performance of the newly launched photo-sharing website in loading their high-resolution images. Which combination of AWS services should you use to serve the files with lowest possible latency? (Select TWO.)
What is the minimum number of Availability Zones that you should set up for your Application Load Balancer in order to create a highly available architecture?

In AWS Trusted Advisor, which of the following options are included among the five categories being considered to analyze your AWS environment and provide the best practice recommendations? (Select TWO.)
An e-commerce company wants to migrate its on-premises infrastructure to Amazon Web Services. However, they are worried about ensuring their migration is secure and efficient.
Which of the following AWS Cloud Adoption Framework perspective would be the most essential for the company's migration?
What should you provide to your developers to allow them to access your AWS services through the AWS CLI?
Which of the following can you use to resolve the connection between your on-premises VPN and your Amazon VPC (Amazon Virtual Private Cloud)? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following provides the most granular data about AWS costs and usage and can also load that information into Amazon Athena, Amazon Redshift, Amazon QuickSight, or a preferred tool?
Which of the following best describes what Amazon CloudWatch can be used for?
An audit service that records all API calls made in your AWS account
A repository for metrics and logs
column2: A repository for metrics and logs

column1: Which among the options below is a highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System (DNS) web service in AWS?
Which service provides an event history of your AWS account activity, including actions taken through the AWS Management Console, AWS SDKs, command line tools, and other AWS services?
Which AWS service helps identify resources shared with an external entity and generates policies based on access activity?
A company is designing a new cloud architecture for its mission-critical application in AWS which must be highly-available. Which of the following is the recommended pattern to meet this requirement?
Make sure that each component of the application has high bandwidth and low-latency network connectivity using ENIs.
Use multiple Availability Zones to ensure that the application can handle the failure of any single component.
Deploy an Amazon EC2 Spot Fleet with a diversified allocation strategy.
column2: Use multiple Availability Zones to ensure that the application can handle the failure of any single component.

column1: A company is currently using an On-Demand EC2 instance for their application which they plan to migrate to a Reserved EC2 Instance to save on cost. Which of the following is the most cost-effective option if the application being hosted would be used for more than 3 years?
No Upfront Convertible Reserved Instance pricing for a 3-year term.
All Upfront Convertible Reserved Instance pricing for a 1-year term.
No Upfront Standard Reserved Instance pricing for a 1-year term that is renewed every year.
All Upfront, Standard Reserved Instance pricing for a 3-year term.
column2: All Upfront, Standard Reserved Instance pricing for a 3-year term.

column1: Which of the following options below is solely the responsibility of the customer in accordance with the AWS shared responsibility model?
Service and Communications Protection or Zone Security
Patching of the host operating system
column2: Service and Communications Protection or Zone Security

column1: Which Elastic Load Balancer can support path-based routing, host-based routing, and bi-directional communication channels using WebSockets?
Both the Application Load Balancer and Network Load Balancer
Which of the following Amazon EC2 instance purchasing options can help you address compliance requirements and reduce costs by allowing you to use your existing server-bound software licenses?

There is a requirement to launch a new database in AWS where the customer assumes the responsibility and management of the guest operating system, including updates and security patches. Which of the following services should the customer use?
Which of the following can a developer use to interact with your AWS services? (Select TWO.)
In AWS, _______ is one of the advantages of Consolidated Billing.
Consolidation of both AWS and AISPL accounts into one billing.
The ability to have one member account to pay the charges of all the master accounts.

A startup is developing a mobile app with a database service to store user data. The app is expected to grow rapidly, and the company needs a flexible and scalable database service that can handle unpredictable traffic and workload spikes.
Which service should the startup use if they need a scalable, fast, and flexible non-relational database service?
Which of the following IAM identities is associated with the access keys that are used in managing your cloud resources via the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI)?
What service provides the lowest-cost storage option for retaining database backups which also allows occasional data retrieval in minutes?
A company is in the process of choosing the most suitable AWS Region to migrate its applications. Which of the following factors should they consider? (Select TWO.)
Enhance customer experiences by reducing latency to users.
Proximity to your end-users for on-site visits to your on-premises data center.
Support country-specific data sovereignty compliance requirements.
Potential volume discounts for the specific AWS Region.
column2: Enhance customer experiences by reducing latency to users.

column1: Support country-specific data sovereignty compliance requirements.
Which AWS service allows your EC2 compute capacity to automatically scale based on the incoming traffic?
Which of the following characteristics correctly describes the Amazon Simple Storage Service? (Select TWO.)
A storage service with virtually unlimited space
A highly durable object storage infrastructure
A durable, high throughput file system
column2: A storage service with virtually unlimited space

column1: A highly durable object storage infrastructure
Which of the following is the most cost-effective AWS Support Plan to use if you need access to AWS Support API for programmatic case management?
Which of the following is a key financial benefit of migrating systems hosted on your on-premises data center to AWS?
Opportunity to replace variable operational expenses (OPEX) with low upfront capital expenses (CAPEX).
Opportunity to replace variable capital expenses (CAPEX) with low upfront costs.
Opportunity to replace upfront capital expenses (CAPEX) with low variable costs.
Opportunity to replace upfront operational expenses (OPEX) with low variable operational expenses (OPEX).
column2: Opportunity to replace upfront capital expenses (CAPEX) with low variable costs.

column1: Which of the following AWS Global Infrastructure components is made up of one or more discrete data centers, each with redundant power, networking, and connectivity and housed in separate facilities?

For security audit purposes, a company needs to download compliance-related documents in AWS such as ISO certifications, Payment Card Industry (PCI), and Service Organization Control (SOC) reports. Where can they retrieve these files?
A customer is planning to migrate some of their web applications that are hosted on-premises to AWS. Which of the following is a benefit of using AWS over virtualized data centers?
Higher variable costs and lower upfront costs.
Lower variable costs and lower upfront costs.
Higher variable costs and higher upfront costs.
Lower variable costs and higher upfront costs.
column2: Lower variable costs and lower upfront costs.

column1: Which of the following is true on how AWS lessens the time to provision your IT resources?
It provides an AI-powered IT ticketing platform for fulfilling resource requests.
It provides various ways to programmatically provision IT resources.
It provides express service to deliver your servers to your data centers fast.
It provides an automated system of requesting and fulfilling IT resources from third-party vendors.
column2: It provides various ways to programmatically provision IT resources.

column1: Which Amazon EC2 instance purchasing option allows you to take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud and provides up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices?
Which of the following allows you to categorize and track your AWS costs on a detailed level?
Which of the following are true regarding Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)? (Select TWO.)
Simplifies the management of time-consuming database administration tasks
Automatically scales up the relational database instance size based on the incoming workload
Makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database
It is a fully managed nonrelational database service
column2: Simplifies the management of time-consuming database administration tasks

column1: Makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale a relational database
Which two services are used for Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) security and can be found in the VPC dashboard in the AWS Console? (Select TWO.)
A company is using Amazon S3 to store their static media contents such as photos and videos. Which of the following should you use to provide specific users access to the bucket?
Which of the following Cost Management Tools allows tracking of Amazon EC2 Reserved Instance (RI) usage and provides visibility into the discounted RI rate charged to resources?
Among the following services, which is the most suitable one to use to store the results of I/O-intensive SQL database queries to improve application performance?
Which AWS service enables you to build event-driven applications and decouple the components of your application architecture?
Which AWS services should you use to store rapidly changing data and has low read and write latencies? (Select TWO.)
How can you apply and easily manage the common access permissions to a large number of IAM users in AWS?
Attach the necessary policies or permissions required to a new IAM Group then afterwards, add the IAM Users to the IAM group.
Apply permissions to multiple IAM Users by using a cross-account role.
Attach the exact same IAM Policy to all of the IAM Users.
Attach the IAM Policy to an IAM Role then afterwards, associate that role to all of the IAM Users.
column2: Attach the necessary policies or permissions required to a new IAM Group then afterwards, add the IAM Users to the IAM group.

column1: Which among the options below can you use to launch a new Amazon RDS database cluster to your VPC? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following should be used to automatically transfer infrequently accessed data in an Amazon S3 bucket to a more cost-effective storage class?
In Amazon EC2, which pricing construct adjusts its price based on supply and demand of EC2 instances?
Which service allows the addition of powerful visual analysis features to applications, enabling the search, verification, and organization of millions of images?

A customer needs to establish a dedicated connection between their on-premises network and their AWS VPC that provides a more consistent network experience than Internet-based connections. Which of the following network services should they use?
Which AWS service centralizes and automates the backup of data across AWS services and on-premises environments, including compute, storage, and database resources?
__________ lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define.
Which of the following are the best practices that can help secure your AWS resources using the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) service? (Select TWO.)
Lock away your AWS account root user access keys.
Use Inline Policies instead of Customer Managed Policies.
column2: Lock away your AWS account root user access keys.

column1: Which of the following is a fully managed database in AWS that can be used to store JSON documents?
Which of the following are the characteristics of Amazon EC2 Convertible Reserved Instances? (Select TWO.)
Allows you to match your capacity reservation to a predictable recurring schedule that only requires a fraction of a day, a week, or a month
Allows the change of instance family, operating system, tenancy, and payment option
Provides the most significant discount of the RI types and are best suited for steady-state usage
Allows you to change the attributes of the RI as long as the exchange results in the creation of Reserved Instances of equal or lesser value
Has the capability to change the attributes of the RI as long as the exchange results in the creation of Reserved Instances of equal or greater value
column2: Allows the change of instance family, operating system, tenancy, and payment option

column1: Has the capability to change the attributes of the RI as long as the exchange results in the creation of Reserved Instances of equal or greater value
Which is a machine learning-powered security service that discovers, classifies, and protects sensitive data such as personally identifiable information (PII) or intellectual property?
Which among the following services or feature can be used to test and troubleshoot IAM and resource-based policies?
Which of the following tasks fall under the sole responsibility of AWS based on the shared responsibility model?
Which of the following cloud design principles supports growth in users, traffic, or data size with no drop-in performance?
Go Serverless to reduce compute footprint
Which of the following AWS service enables customers to analyze, investigate, and identify the root cause of potential security issues or suspicious activities in their AWS environment?
Which of the following is one of the benefits of migrating your systems from an on-premises data center to AWS Cloud?
Enables the customer to eliminate high IT infrastructure costs since cloud computing is absolutely free
Completely eliminates the administrative overhead of patching the guest operating system of their EC2 instances
Eliminates the need for the customer to implement client-side or service-side encryption for their data
Enables the customer to focus on business activities rather than on the heavy lifting of racking, stacking, and powering servers
column2: Enables the customer to focus on business activities rather than on the heavy lifting of racking, stacking, and powering servers

column1: Which AWS Billing and Cost Management tool allows the forecasting of future costs and usage of AWS resources based on past consumption?
When a company uses AWS and decouple from their on-premises data center, they will be able to have which of the following benefits? (Select TWO.)
Deferred payments to their operational expenditures.
Replace low variable costs with upfront capital expenses (CAPEX).
Massive discounts for bare metal servers from Amazon.com.
Which of the following is a valid characteristic of an IAM Group?
A group can contain many users, and a user can belong to multiple groups.
There is a default group that automatically includes all users in the AWS account.
There's no limit to the number of groups you can have.
column2: A group can contain many users, and a user can belong to multiple groups.

column1: A leading company wants to ensure that its cloud services are consistently delivered at the agreed-upon level of its business stakeholders. The company is considering using the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) to guide its cloud operations.
Which capabilities within the AWS CAF's Operations perspective would be most helpful for the company?
Which of the following is not required when launching an EBS-backed EC2 instance?
Which of the following policies grant the necessary permissions required to access Amazon S3 resources? (Select TWO.)

A new AWS customer needs to deploy up to 100 t3a.large Amazon EC2 instances on a recently launched Amazon VPC, which is way beyond the default service limit. What should be done to launch the additional instances?
Do nothing. You can directly launch 100 t3a.large EC2 instances at the same time since AWS will automatically increase your service limit for you.
Create a case in the AWS Support Center page and request a service limit increase.
Use AWS Trusted Advisor to increase the default service limits for EC2 instances.
column2: Create a case in the AWS Support Center page and request a service limit increase.

column1: Which of the following provides software solutions that are either hosted on or integrated with the AWS platform which may include Independent Software Vendors (ISVs), SaaS, PaaS, developer tools, management, and security vendors?
Which of the following will allow you to create a data warehouse in AWS for your business intelligence needs?
In AWS, which of the following is a design principle that you should implement when designing your cloud architecture?
Always use large servers to anticipate increase usage
Which of the following statements accurately describes the AWS Shared Responsibility model?
Both AWS and customers are equally responsible for securing the physical infrastructure of the cloud, applications, and data in the cloud.
Customers are responsible for securing the physical infrastructure of the cloud, while AWS is responsible for securing their applications and data in the cloud.

AWS is responsible for securing the physical infrastructure of the cloud, applications, and data in the cloud, while customers are only responsible for managing the access and identity of their users.
AWS is responsible for securing the physical infrastructure of the cloud, while customers are responsible for securing their applications and data in the cloud.
column2: AWS is responsible for securing the physical infrastructure of the cloud, while customers are responsible for securing their applications and data in the cloud.

column1: What is the most secure way to provide applications temporary access to your AWS resources?
Create an IAM policy that allows the application to access the resources, and attach the policy to the application
Create an IAM group that has access to the resources, and add the application there
Create an IAM user with access keys and assign it to the application
Create an IAM role and have the application assume the role
column2: Create an IAM role and have the application assume the role

column1: Which of the following is the most cost-effective payment option when you purchase either a Standard or Convertible Reserved Instance for a 1-year term?

A customer currently has a Basic support plan and they are planning to use the Infrastructure Event Management, Well-Architected Reviews and Operations Reviews features in AWS. What should they do in order to access these features in the most cost-effective manner?
None since these features are already included in their Basic support plan.

A customer is building a cloud architecture in AWS which should scale horizontally or vertically in order to automatically adjust capacity and maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost. Which of the following statements are true regarding horizontal and vertical scaling? (Select TWO.)
Upgrading to a higher EC2 instance type is an example of Horizontal Scaling
Adding more EC2 instances to your resource pool is an example of Vertical Scaling
Adding more EC2 instances to your resource pool is an example of Horizontal Scaling
Upgrading to a higher EC2 instance type is an example of Vertical Scaling
Upgrading to a higher EC2 instance type and adding more EC2 instances to your resource pool are both examples of Horizontal Scaling
column2: Adding more EC2 instances to your resource pool is an example of Horizontal Scaling

column1: Upgrading to a higher EC2 instance type is an example of Vertical Scaling
There is an incident with your team where an S3 object was deleted using an account without the owner's knowledge. What can be done to prevent unauthorized deletion of your S3 objects?
Create access control policies so that only you can perform S3-related actions
Set up stricter IAM policies that will prevent users from deleting S3 objects
Configure MFA delete on the S3 bucket.
Set your S3 buckets to private so that objects are not publicly readable/writable
column2: Configure MFA delete on the S3 bucket.

column1: In the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, whose responsibility is it to patch the host operating system of an Amazon EC2 instance?
Which of the following are defined as global services in AWS? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select TWO.)
Which service does AWS use to notify customers when AWS is experiencing events that may have an impact on AWS resources?

A website is experiencing varying levels of traffic throughout the day and is not fully consuming server capacity all the time. Which advantage does AWS Cloud provide over traditional data centers when it comes to handling traffic load?
Which AWS service is commonly used for streaming data in real-time?

The IT Security team of a company needs to conduct a vulnerability analysis on its application servers to ensure that the Amazon EC2 instances comply with the annual security IT audit. An automated security assessment service must be set up to improve the security and compliance of the applications. The solution should automatically assess applications for exposure, vulnerabilities, and deviations from AWS best practices.
Which of the following options would be implemented to satisfy this requirement?
What is the best type of instance purchasing option to choose if you will run an EC2 instance for 3 months to perform a job that is uninterruptible?
Which of the following is true regarding the Business support plan in AWS?
Provides a 15-minute response time support if your business-critical system goes down
Provides a 1-hour response time support if your production system got impaired
Provides a 15-minute response time support if your production system goes down
Provides a 1-hour response time support if your production system goes down
column2: Provides a 1-hour response time support if your production system goes down

column1: A company needs to troubleshoot an issue on their serverless application which is composed of an API Gateway, Lambda function, and a DynamoDB database. Which service should they use to trace user requests as they travel through their entire application?
Which of the following actions will incur AWS charges? (Select TWO.)
Provisioning elastic IPs and attaching them to running EC2 instances
Transfer of EC2 files between two AWS Regions
Network charges for the transfer of data from your data center to S3 through a VPN
Using AWS CloudFormation to create resources
Setting up additional VPCs in your account
column2: Provisioning elastic IPs and attaching them to running EC2 instances

column1: Transfer of EC2 files between two AWS Regions
Which of the following cloud best practices reinforces the use of the Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) design principle?

A startup wants to move its on-premises infrastructure to AWS. The IT Security team wants to protect all of the applications against unintended and unauthorized access as well as potential vulnerabilities.
Which of the following capability of AWS CAF's Security perspective would be most relevant to address this concern?
Which of the following services are part of the AWS serverless platform that does not require provisioning, maintaining, and administering servers for backend components? (Select TWO.)
What services will help create a highly available and scalable web app in the cloud? (Select TWO.)
Which service would you use to speed up content delivery to your customers?

A manufacturing company has multiple AWS accounts for various departments. As the company grows, they are experiencing an increase in its AWS costs and want to optimize its expenses by taking advantage of any available discounts.
Which of the following actions below will allow you to take advantage of volume discounts in AWS?
Use AWS Organizations and enable the consolidated billing feature.
Move all of your AWS resources from multiple accounts to a single global account.
Opt for an All upfront Convertible Reserved Instance pricing for a 3-year term.
Upgrade to an AWS Enterprise support plan.
column2: Use AWS Organizations and enable the consolidated billing feature.

column1: Which of the following is a threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious activity and unauthorized behavior to protect your AWS accounts and workloads?
Which of the following is typically used to secure Amazon VPC subnets?
In compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) federal law, a US-based company is required to provide SOC 1 and SOC 2 reports of its cloud resources.
Where are these AWS compliance documents located?
Which of the following is used to enable instances in the public subnet to connect to the public Internet?

A company wants to launch a Microsoft SQL Server database in AWS. The database instance should only be managed by the company's DBA and must be accessible via RDP. A standard license for SQL Server is required but the company is not yet sure how much CPU and memory to allocate to the database.
Which option gives the most convenience and flexibility to determine the best database size while still being cost-effective?
Launch an EC2 instance and install MS SQL Server. Purchase a Standard MSSQL license from Microsoft and apply it to the database you installed
Use a Windows Server with SQL Server Standard bundled AMI so you won't need to buy and manage your own license
Launch an RDS instance that runs MS SQL Server Standard. Purchase a Standard MSSQL license and store it in the AWS Managed Services
Launch an Amazon Aurora database that runs MS SQL Server. Buy a Standard MSSQL license from the AWS License Manager service
column2: Use a Windows Server with SQL Server Standard bundled AMI so you won't need to buy and manage your own license

column1: Which of the following is the most cost-effective instance purchasing option for hosting an application which will run non-interruptible workloads for a period of three years?

A customer needs to retrieve the instance ID, instance profile permissions, and kernel information of their EC2 instance for an app that is running within the same instance. Where can the customer find this information?

Which of the following is best suited for load balancing Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and Transport Layer Security (TLS) traffic and has the capability of handling millions of requests per second while maintaining ultra-low latencies?
You are permitted to conduct security assessments and penetration testing without prior approval against which AWS resources? (Select TWO.)

Which of the following should be used to provide temporary AWS credentials for users who have been authenticated via social media logins, as well as for guest users who do not require any authentication?

A customer has a number of on-demand instances running simultaneously to serve customer transactions. Occasionally, most of these instances do not perform any tasks when demand is low. What is a good cost optimization strategy to implement for this case?
Scale up the instances to a higher instance type to reduce the number of running instances at a time
Create a script that would automatically shut down an instance when utilization is low
Use spot instances instead of on-demand instances
Implement an auto scaling group to control the number of running instances at a time
column2: Implement an auto scaling group to control the number of running instances at a time

column1: A space agency is using Amazon S3 to store their high-resolution satellite images and videos everyday. Which of the following should they do to minimize the upload time?
Shift to S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class
Upload the images and videos using the BatchWriteItem API
A customer in North Virginia, USA, is doing some drone work and collecting environmental data.
Which of the following options allows easy access to terabytes of data storage for use in a space-constrained environment and allows data transfer to AWS?
An insurance company plans to use AWS to visually create, run, and monitor ETL workflows. Which AWS service would be recommended to meet this requirement?
You are planning to create point-in-time backups of your Amazon EBS volumes. Which of the following are correct statements? (Select TWO.)
You can take EBS backups by creating Amazon Machine Images (AMIs)
You can create point-in-time backups through EBS snapshots
You can take EBS backups by creating Amazon Machine Images (AMIs)
Backing up the same EBS volume will create a new back up of the whole volume
Instances will have to be stopped first to start the EBS backup
EBS backups are stored durably in Amazon S3
column2: You can create point-in-time backups through EBS snapshots

column1: EBS backups are stored durably in Amazon S3
Which of the following capabilities of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) are under the Governance perspective? (Select TWO)
Which of the following options allows customers to find, buy, and immediately start using the software and services that run on AWS?
Which of the following security group rules are valid? (Select TWO.)
Outbound MYSQL rule with IP address as source
Inbound TCP rule with instance ID as source
Inbound RDP rule with an address range as source
Outbound HTTPS rule with hostname as destination
Inbound HTTP rule with security group ID as source
column2: Inbound RDP rule with an address range as source

column1: Inbound HTTP rule with security group ID as source

A company is using Amazon S3 to store various types of documents in a single bucket, and different teams frequently access the stored objects. If the document is accidentally overwritten or deleted, the data must be recoverable. Which of the following S3 features should they use?
Which of the following services allows storing Docker images and orchestrating Docker containers in a simple and cost-effective manner? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following are advantages of Cloud Computing? (Select TWO.)
Trade capital expense for variable expense.
Trade variable expense for capital expense.
Massive discounts for your computers, network devices and other equipment from Amazon online shopping website.

column2: Trade capital expense for variable expense.

column1: Which of the following will allow users to trade upfront infrastructure costs for flexible operational costs in AWS?
Use AWS Elastic Beanstalk to automate application deployment and management, ensuring seamless scaling of compute resources without incurring additional costs.
Eliminate guessing about users' infrastructure capacity needs.
Mitigate upfront infrastructure costs by transitioning from having on-premises data centers to AWS services.
Use AWS Cost Explorer to analyze service costs and usage and to forecast future expenses.
column2: Mitigate upfront infrastructure costs by transitioning from having on-premises data centers to AWS services.

column1: How can your RDS production instances be more cost-effective when they will be used for a long period of time?
AWS does not charge you when your RDS is idle
You can easily backup, terminate, and restore RDS instances when you need them
You can request reserved instances to get discounts on your instance costs
You can stop your RDS instances when idle to prevent AWS from charging you during this time
column2: You can request reserved instances to get discounts on your instance costs

column1: Which business intelligence tool is offered by Amazon Web Services and allows users to create and publish interactive dashboards and reports easily?
What service allows you to create alarms that notify you when EC2 CPU Utilization thresholds are breached?
A Software Developer is working on an application for a startup. The company wants to incorporate a conversational interface that allows customers to interact with the app through voice and text.
Which of the following AWS service would help the developer to build the application?

A company intends to utilize Amazon EC2 instances and AWS Lambda functions as their primary compute resources in the long term. The company wants to use these compute resources for at least 3 years at the cheapest cost.
Which AWS purchasing options would optimize the company's computing costs?
Which of the following practices demonstrate operational excellence in AWS cloud? (Select TWO.)
Launching your infrastructure manually via the Console
Use serverless applications such as AWS Lambda
Monitor Amazon EC2 metric consumption and adjust the instance type accordingly
Deploy small, incremental changes to your production servers using AWS CodeDeploy
Perform monthly game days on your AWS environment
column2: Deploy small, incremental changes to your production servers using AWS CodeDeploy

column1: Perform monthly game days on your AWS environment
Which service in AWS protects resources from common DDoS attacks in a proactive manner?

A company decided to migrate its operation to the AWS Cloud by leveraging on the different AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) perspectives to identify capability gaps and cross-organizational dependencies.
Which phase of the cloud transformation journey do these plans belong to?
What is the primary reason why you should be using an elastic load balancer for a website with high activity?
ELBs boost your website's overall performance
ELBs can distribute traffic equally to your backend targets to handle the incoming traffic load
ELBs help you scale servers easily without manual intervention
ELBs help tighten security through the use of security groups
column2: ELBs can distribute traffic equally to your backend targets to handle the incoming traffic load

column1: A Software Engineer is working on a new project for the company. The project entails creating a web application with the PHP framework and releasing it to the AWS Cloud. Given the company's limited resources and the Software Engineer's tight deadline, the Software Engineer must devise a plan for quickly deploying the application to AWS while avoiding the time-consuming process of setting up and configuring the infrastructure.
Which of the following services will allow the Software Engineer to quickly deploy the application into the AWS Cloud without building or launching the individual resources?
The use of multi-threading in Amazon S3 requests via the Multipart Upload API is an example of which AWS cloud best practice?
Among the following payment options, which of the following can be chosen when purchasing a Standard or Convertible Reserved Instance? (Select THREE.)
Which of the following AWS well-architected pillars discusses the use of the right computing resources to meet demand levels even as the demand changes and technologies evolve?
Which of the following is a serverless compute service of AWS?
What is the best way to keep track of all activities made in your AWS account?
Set up MFA logging to know who is currently in your environment
Use LDAP authentication on your AWS account
Create a multi-region trail in AWS CloudTrail
Use Amazon CloudWatch Logs to log all activities
column2: Create a multi-region trail in AWS CloudTrail

column1: Which type of Amazon EC2 instance is the most suitable and cost-effective if the customer will be running mission-critical workloads continuously for a whole year?
Which type of Elastic Load Balancer allows you to forward the incoming request to a target group with a Lambda function as a target?
Both Gateway Load Balancer and Network Load Balancer
Which of the following services allow the purchase of Reserved Instances? (Select TWO.)
A company needs to simplify the migration of its databases from an on-premises server to AWS. Which service fits best for this purpose?

A company has a fleet of on-premises servers that require a centralized scalable and durable file storage. It should be able to support massive parallel access. Which of the following is the most appropriate service to use?

A DevOps Engineer hosted an e-commerce website on AWS in the US East (Northern Virginia) region. Due to recent regulatory changes, the company decided to expand its operations and launch a new instance of the e-commerce website in the Europe (London) region. The DevOps Engineer's task is to replicate the entire infrastructure of the existing e-commerce website in the new region with the least possible downtime.
Which of the following is best to replicate the entire infrastructure to another AWS Region with the least possible downtime?
Take an EBS snapshot on all your storage devices and copy them to the new region
Create a golden AMI which you can use to redeploy your instances to the new region
Enable RDS multi-AZ to have a similar database instance running in the new region
Create a CloudFormation template and deploy it in the new region
column2: Create a CloudFormation template and deploy it in the new region

column1: Which of the following is the responsibility of the customer in the AWS cloud? (Select TWO.)
Ensuring that AWS services comply with the standards required of them
Upgrading chipsets to the latest commercially available product
Managing data stored in the AWS resources
Managing users in their AWS account
column2: Managing data stored in the AWS resources

column1: Managing users in their AWS account
A startup has recently migrated its infrastructure to the AWS cloud and wants to ensure that users can access the right resources.
Which IAM feature is responsible for enforcing privileges and access controls in the AWS environment?
A customer needs to identify the IAM user who terminated their production EC2 instance in AWS. Which service should they use in this situation?
A company has multiple AWS accounts. How can they take advantage of this to save on their monthly costs?
Use AWS Organizations and enable consolidated billing
Set a budget for each account to minimize spending
Migrate all resources to a central account to take advantage of volume discounts
Create an IAM Group containing all the AWS accounts and enable consolidated billing
column2: Use AWS Organizations and enable consolidated billing

column1: Your web servers are showing relatively poor performance in delivering content. How can you improve its performance and cost efficiency?
Apply a caching mechanism that stores frequently accessed content
Run more web servers to distribute the workload
Use HTTP protocol instead to decrease the time consumed in decrypting content
Request AWS to use faster network cables for your servers
column2: Apply a caching mechanism that stores frequently accessed content

column1: What is the minimum support plan that will provide you access to all Trusted Advisor Checks?
Which feature enables the labeling and sorting of Amazon EC2 instances based on the deployment stage (e.g., development, staging, production)?

A company has noticed that whenever they enter the domain name of their Application Load Balancer (ALB) on a browser, they cannot reach one of their EC2 web servers behind the ALB. Which of the following should you first check to gain more insight on the issue?
What service acts as a firewall for your EC2 instances?
What is the main benefit you receive when moving to serverless from non-serverless compute services?
Serverless removes management overhead so you can focus on your applications instead
Serverless are highly available so you don't have to worry about downtime
You get overall cheaper costs compared to using non-serverless services
Security is fully managed for you by the service provider
column2: Serverless removes management overhead so you can focus on your applications instead

column1: What service should you use in order to add user sign-up, sign-in, and access control to your mobile app with a feature that supports sign-in with social identity providers such as Facebook, Google, and Amazon, and enterprise identity providers via SAML 2.0?
Which of the following provides you access to Reserved Instance (RI) purchase recommendations based on your past usage and indicate potential opportunities for savings as compared to On-Demand usage?
Which of the following infrastructure correlates to a VPC's subnet?
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely. Which of the following best describes what an account alias is in IAM?
The numerical value of your account ID
A substitute for an account ID in the web address for your account
The name AWS assigns to your account
column2: A substitute for an account ID in the web address for your account

column1: Which AWS service allows the provisioning of Windows or Linux desktops within minutes and can scale efficiently to support thousands of desktops for workers?
A static website needs to be hosted in AWS at a low cost. Which service should be used for this purpose?
In which of the following occasions should you use the Amazon SQS in your application system? (Select TWO.)
If you need to submit push notifications to your event subscribers
When you have to automate certain tasks in your workflow
If you require a durable storage for your application events or messages
When your application requires the use of industry-standard messaging protocols for message delivery
If you need to decouple certain parts of your system for better fault tolerance
column2: If you require a durable storage for your application events or messages

column1: If you need to decouple certain parts of your system for better fault tolerance
A startup plans to build a data lake using Amazon S3 as the primary storage platform. Which of the following options would incur costs? (Select TWO.)

You have a large number of log files that will be archived in AWS for a long time and should have a retrieval time of 12 hours or less. Which service is the most cost-effective storage class for this purpose?

A Cloud Architect in a large e-commerce company manages the company's AWS environment. One day, the Cloud Architect was notified that one of their EC2 instances had been running non-stop for over 30 days, and its usage costs had skyrocketed. The Cloud Architect needs to identify the root cause of the issue and find a way to reduce the usage costs of the instance.
Which of the following AWS services can help the Cloud Architect identify the issue and check if their running resources conform to AWS best practices?
Which security services in AWS use intelligent systems and machine learning to quickly identify potential security threats and issues in your AWS account? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following statements is true for AWS CloudTrail?
CloudTrail is disabled by default for newly created AWS accounts
CloudTrail is able to capture application error logs from your Amazon EC2 instances
CloudTrail charges you for every management event trail created
When you create a trail in the AWS Management Console, the trail applies to all AWS Regions by default
column2: When you create a trail in the AWS Management Console, the trail applies to all AWS Regions by default

column1: A company is planning to deploy a high-frequency trading (HFT) application that will store constantly changing financial data in AWS and require low-latency access.
Which AWS services should be used? (Select TWO.)
Which of the following is true about the enhanced technical support response times of the Enterprise support plan in AWS? (Select TWO.)
Provides a 1-hour response time support if your production system goes down
Provides a 48-hour response time support for general guidance
Provides a 2-hour response time support if your production system got impaired
Provides a 15-minute response time support if your business-critical system goes down
Provides a 12-hour response time support for general guidance
column2: Provides a 1-hour response time support if your production system goes down

column1: Provides a 15-minute response time support if your business-critical system goes down
Which service in AWS supports various business intelligence tools such as Apache Spark so that you may perform data transformation workloads (ETL) and analytics at a low cost?

You are planning to deploy a video streaming application with frequently accessed, throughput-intensive workloads to your EC2 instance which requires fast, consistent throughput. What EBS volume type should you use to maximize performance as well as cost?
Which AWS support plan includes a Concierge Support Team which will assist you with your billing and account inquiries, and work with you to implement billing and account best practices?
Which of the following is the most cost-effective service to coordinate multiple AWS services into serverless workflows?

A manufacturing company is undergoing an organizational transformation to focus more on its customers, aiming to maximize the value delivered to them. This shift involves promoting team collaboration to ensure alignment with the firm's strategic objectives.
How can the company achieve this goal while following the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF)? (Choose two.)
Employ a robust data and analytics platform to generate actionable insights.
Transition and upgrade legacy infrastructure through migration and modernization efforts.
Restructure teams to prioritize product-focused and value stream-oriented approaches.
Introduce new products and revenue models.
Adopt agile methodologies for continuous improvement and rapid innovation.
column2: Restructure teams to prioritize product-focused and value stream-oriented approaches.

column1: Adopt agile methodologies for continuous improvement and rapid innovation.
An organization would like to boost productivity by improving business communication channels and customer service experience.
Which of the following AWS applications would be suggested? (Select TWO.)

Which of these is AWS's digital user engagement service that enables customers to effectively communicate with end users and measure engagement across multiple channels, including email, text messaging (SMS), and mobile push notifications?
What type of EBS volume is recommended for most workloads and is also usable as a boot volume?
Which of the following is true regarding the AWS Cost and Usage report? (Select TWO.)
Helps you visualize, understand, and manage your AWS costs and usage over time via an intuitive interface that enables you to quickly create custom reports
Provides you with granular data about your AWS costs and usage

Provides you a dashboard that lets you view the status of your month-to-date AWS expenditure and provides access to a number of other cost management products that can help you dig deeper into your AWS costs and usage
Allows you to load your cost and usage information into Amazon Athena, Amazon Redshift, and AWS QuickSight
Lets you set custom cost and usage budgets that alert you when those thresholds are exceeded
column2: Provides you with granular data about your AWS costs and usage

column1: Allows you to load your cost and usage information into Amazon Athena, Amazon Redshift, and AWS QuickSight
Which of the following instances is it better to use IAM roles rather than IAM users? (Select TWO.)
If you have employees who will constantly need access to your AWS resources
When you want to provide AWS services permissions to do certain actions
When you need a GUI to interact with your AWS environment
When you need an administrator to handle the AWS account for you
When you have outside entities that need to perform specific actions in your AWS account
column2: When you want to provide AWS services permissions to do certain actions

column1: When you have outside entities that need to perform specific actions in your AWS account
You have an Amazon Linux EC2 instance running for an hour and thirty minutes. How will AWS bill you in terms of usage?
You will only be billed for an hour according to the hourly billing rule
You will be billed for one hour and thirty minutes according to the hourly billing rule
You will be billed for an hour and thirty minutes according to the per-second billing rule
You will be billed for an hour and twenty-nine minutes according to the per second billing rule
column2: You will be billed for an hour and thirty minutes according to the per-second billing rule

column1: A company needs to run its workloads in a hybrid cloud. Due to regulatory compliance, some parts of the overall infrastructure need to be on-premises. The company wants to leverage the same API calls for both its AWS cloud and on-premises workloads.
Which AWS service or offering is used to meet these requirements?
What is an advantage of cloud computing when it comes to equipment expenditures?
You can easily scale and manage the number of resources running in your cloud environment.
AWS makes sure that physical devices are continuously secured and monitored.
AWS introduces cost reductions each year in their services.
AWS uses the cheapest possible equipment for their data centers so that they do not charge expensive fees.
column2: You can easily scale and manage the number of resources running in your cloud environment.

column1: A customer is using Amazon S3 to store sprites of game characters. When players retrieve these sprites, they are temporarily stored on the player's computer. The sprites are currently stored in the S3 Standard storage class. Which of the following options would you recommend to optimize storage costs?
Add a lifecycle policy to move sprites to S3 Standard - Infrequent Access after the customer uploads them.
Have the customer directly upload the sprites to S3 Standard - Infrequent Access.
Add a lifecycle policy to move sprites to S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval after the customer uploads them.
Have the customer compress the sprites to reduce storage consumption.
column2: Add a lifecycle policy to move sprites to S3 Standard - Infrequent Access after the customer uploads them.
